newsitem.title: USA: Ten firms bid for surplus U.S. cobalt.
newsitem.headline: Ten firms bid for surplus U.S. cobalt.

text.p: Ten firms submitted bids Monday to the U.S. Defense Logistics Agency to buy surplus cobalt.

The bids totalled 999,537 pounds, and prices offered ranged from a low of $10.00 per pound for 993 pounds of 99.30 percent grade cobalt, submitted by S. Wilkoff & Sons, to a high of $20.39 per pound for two bids from Phoenixx International for 29,946 pounds of 99.42 percent grade cobalt.
The winning bids will be announced Thursday, a DLA official said.
